back_cards.definition_en: A vehicle with four wheels used for personal transportation
back_cards.example_en: She drove her car to the grocery store.

back_cards.definition_en: A mode of transport for long-distance travel
back_cards.example_en: We rented a car to explore the countryside.

back_cards.definition_en: A vehicle used in professional racing
back_cards.example_en: The race car sped around the track at incredible speeds.

back_cards.definition_en: A car as a shared resource in a household
back_cards.example_en: Dad took the car, so I had to walk to school.

back_cards.definition_en: A car in the context of urban commuting
back_cards.example_en: He avoids traffic by taking his car to work early.
She wants to learn algebra this semester.

back_cards.definition_en: To acquire a new skill through practice
back_cards.example_en: He learned to play the guitar in just a few months.
They learned the importance of teamwork during the project.
I need to learn these vocabulary words for the test.
We learned about the festival from a friend.

back_cards.definition_en: To the smallest extent or degree
back_cards.example_en: She was the least worried about the exam.
He didn’t even make the least attempt to help.

back_cards.definition_en: In comparison to others, the smallest amount
back_cards.example_en: This is the least expensive option available.
The delay was the least of our problems.
Studying was the least of his concerns during the holidays.
She’s already finished her homework.
The bus is already here!
He’s already submitted his project to the teacher.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express surprise at speed
back_cards.example_en: Have you already eaten dinner?
The flowers are already blooming in early spring.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause the death of a living thing
back_cards.example_en: The hunter killed a deer in the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: To end or stop something completely
back_cards.example_en: They killed the plan due to lack of funds.

back_cards.definition_en: To use up time or resources
back_cards.example_en: We killed an hour waiting for the train.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause intense discomfort or pain
back_cards.example_en: These tight shoes are killing my feet.

back_cards.definition_en: To impress or overwhelm in a performance
back_cards.example_en: She killed it with her speech at the conference.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of time equal to 60 seconds
back_cards.example_en: The meeting starts in five minutes.
Can you wait a minute while I grab my coat?
The train arrived at the exact minute it was scheduled.

back_cards.definition_en: A small amount of time in a busy schedule
back_cards.example_en: I don’t have a minute to spare today.
The secretary recorded the minutes of the meeting.
We threw a party for her birthday.

back_cards.definition_en: A political group with shared goals
back_cards.example_en: The party announced its new policies.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people working together
back_cards.example_en: The search party looked for the lost hiker.

back_cards.definition_en: An event with music and dancing
back_cards.example_en: The club hosted a huge party last night.
Both parties signed the contract.

back_cards.definition_en: To contain as a part of something
back_cards.example_en: The package includes a free trial.

back_cards.definition_en: To involve as a necessary part
back_cards.example_en: The project includes input from all team members.

back_cards.definition_en: To add something to a group
back_cards.example_en: Please include me in the group chat.

back_cards.definition_en: To cover in a list or plan
back_cards.example_en: The menu includes vegetarian options.
The study includes data from ten cities.

back_cards.definition_en: To be in an upright position
back_cards.example_en: She stood at the front of the classroom.
His decision to leave stands.
I can’t stand the cold weather.
The flag stands for freedom.

back_cards.definition_en: To be in a particular position
back_cards.example_en: Our team stands first in the rankings.
We worked together to finish the project.
They shouted the answer together.
They’ve been together for five years.
These ingredients taste great together.

back_cards.definition_en: In an organized or composed state
back_cards.example_en: She pulled herself together after the bad news.

back_cards.definition_en: To a previous position or place
back_cards.example_en: He went back to his hometown.
She called back after missing the call.

back_cards.definition_en: In time, referring to the past
back_cards.example_en: I remember back when we were kids.
Step back to avoid the spill.
I’ll pay you back tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To go after someone or something
back_cards.example_en: She followed the guide through the forest.
Please follow the instructions carefully.
The detective followed the suspect’s trail.

back_cards.definition_en: To understand or keep up with
back_cards.example_en: I couldn’t follow the plot of the movie.

back_cards.definition_en: To subscribe to updates, as on social media
back_cards.example_en: He follows his favorite band online.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being physically well
back_cards.example_en: She exercises daily to improve her health.
Talking to friends helps his mental health.

back_cards.definition_en: The condition of an organization or system
back_cards.example_en: The company’s financial health is strong.

back_cards.definition_en: A field of study or care
back_cards.example_en: She works in public health at the hospital.

back_cards.definition_en: A toast or wish for well-being
back_cards.example_en: They raised their glasses to good health.

back_cards.definition_en: To recall a memory or fact
back_cards.example_en: I remember my first day at school.
Remember to lock the door before leaving.
We remember the heroes on Memorial Day.

back_cards.definition_en: To retain information for later use
back_cards.example_en: She remembered the recipe perfectly.
He remembered his grandmother’s kind words.
She often visits her parents on weekends.
He often jogs in the park every morning.
People often forget to drink enough water.
It often rains in the afternoons here.
They often argue about small things.

back_cards.definition_en: A cause or explanation for something
back_cards.example_en: The reason for the delay was bad weather.
She used reason to solve the puzzle.
His reason for quitting was stress.
They had no reason to disagree with the plan.
Fear can cloud one’s reason.
She speaks confidently in meetings.
He speaks Spanish fluently.
The professor will speak at the conference.

back_cards.definition_en: To convey a message or opinion
back_cards.example_en: Her actions speak louder than words.
They spoke with the manager about the issue.
She moved here two years ago.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to a specific past event
back_cards.example_en: The concert was a week ago.
He called ten minutes ago.
Dinosaurs lived millions of years ago.
I saw her a long time ago.
She set the book on the table.
They set a date for the wedding.
He set the table for dinner.
I need to set the clock to the correct time.
The news set off a heated debate.
She wore a black dress to the event.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a racial or ethnic group
back_cards.example_en: The museum showcased Black history.
His black humor surprised everyone.
The room was black during the power outage.
I’ll have my coffee black, please.
